channel.title: Landscape Editor
channel.description:
Hello Out there,
I've tried to find a Landscape Editor, so far i've only found the one called RSC Community Landscape Editor, however im not able to get it working, as it says ''A exception has been thrown, Something may not be working as expected.'' I opened my Landscape.rscd and thats what it said.
I'd appreciate help :)
Signed Chivava

item.title: Landscape Editor
item.dc:creator: @RylandAlmanza RylandAlmanza
item.description:
@RylandAlmanza wrote:

I went ahead and compiled one of the editors for whoever wants it. Just unzip it, and then run “java -jar GUI.jar”
http://ryland.insomnia247.nl/mapeditor.zip

Read full topic

item.title: Landscape Editor
item.dc:creator: @latifundio latifundio
item.description:
@latifundio wrote:

Chivava:

as it says ‘‘A exception has been thrown, Something may not be working as expected.’’

I thought you got this error (see attached pic).

Anyway you can compile from source like i did http://3d-map-editor.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/
or http://rscamap3deditor.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/

Read full topic

item.title: Landscape Editor
item.dc:creator: @Chivava Chivava
item.description:
@Chivava wrote:

There is no run.bat file, also this was when i opened the landscape.rscd file, not the actual landscape editor.

Read full topic

item.title: Landscape Editor
item.dc:creator: @latifundio latifundio
item.description:
@latifundio wrote:

Try using java 6 instead, you don’t even need to uninstall the jre7 if you got your jdk6 installation with jre included.

use something like this on your “run.bat” file (check your jdk update number)

@echo off
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_30\jre\bin\java.exe" -cp editor.jar;lib/xpp3.jar;lib/xstream.jar com.GUI
pause
exit

if not then just change you system variable “PATH” to C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_30\jre\bin

Read full topic
